title: McKean-Vlasov equations involving hitting times: blow-ups and global solvability. (arXiv:2010.14646v3 [math.PR] UPDATED)
abstract: This paper is concerned with the analysis of blow-ups for two McKean-Vlasov equations involving hitting times. Let $(B(t); \, t \ge 0)$ be standard Brownian motion, and $\tau:= \inf\{t \ge 0: X(t) \le 0\}$ be the hitting time to zero of a given process $X$. The first equation is $X(t) = X(0) + B(t) \alpha \mathbb{P}(\tau \le t)$. We provide a simple condition on $\alpha$ and the distribution of $X(0)$ such that the corresponding Fokker-Planck equation has no blow-up, and thus the McKean-Vlasov dynamics is well-defined for all time $t \ge 0$. Our approach relies on a connection between the McKean-Vlasov equation and the supercooled Stefan problem, as well as several comparison principles. translated_title: 涉及击中时间的McKean-Vlasov方程：爆破和全局可解性
translated_abstract: 本文研究了涉及击中时间的两个McKean-Vlasov方程的爆破分析。设$(B(t); \, t \ge 0)$为标准布朗运动，$\tau:= \inf\{t \ge 0: X(t) \le 0\}$为给定过程$X$的零击中时间。第一个方程是$X(t) = X(0) + B(t) \alpha \mathbb{P}(\tau \le t)$。我们给出了关于$\alpha$和$X(0)$分布的简单条件，使得相应的Fokker-Planck方程不会爆破，从而McKean-Vlasov动力学在所有时间$t \ge 0$上都是良定义的。我们的方法依赖于McKean-Vlasov方程与过冷Stefan问题之间的联系，以及几个比较原理。第二个方程是$X(t) = X(0) + \beta t + B(t) + \alpha \log \mathbb{P}(\tau > t)$，其Fokker-Planck方程是非局部的。我们证明了对于充分大的$\beta > 0$和不大于一定小正常数的$\alpha$，不存在爆破现象，并且McKean-Vlasov动力学是存在的。
tldr: 本文研究了两个涉及击中时间的McKean-Vlasov方程的爆破分析，并给出了简单条件使得对应的Fokker-Planck方程不会爆破，从而保证了McKean-Vlasov动力学的全局可解性。
